alert.note: Alert for Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 7:03AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia and western North Carolina, including the following counties, in northeast Georgia, Rabun. In western North Carolina, Macon. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 AM EDT, High levels of runoff throughout the advised area will continue this morning, especially in parts of the Little Tennessee, Nantahala and Chattooga basins. Significant flows will continue along the larger streams in this area, causing elevated flows and out-of-bank conditions to persist. Residents along the Tallulah River below Lake Burton, especially below Mathis Dam need to remain alert for potential reservoir releases due to very high flows feeding Lake Burton. If significant releases occur, a Flash Flood Warning may be needed. Please stay weather aware. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
